questions.chapter: Getting Started with Claude and Skills
questions.question_text: What does invoking a skill with a slash command like `/quiz-generator` accomplish?
What is the primary purpose of a course description in intelligent textbook development?
What is Bloom's Taxonomy?
How many cognitive levels are in the 2001 revision of Bloom's Taxonomy?
Which cognitive level in Bloom's Taxonomy involves recalling facts, terms, and basic concepts?
What distinguishes the 'Understand' level from the 'Remember' level in Bloom's Taxonomy?
A learning outcome states: 'Students will be able to use the Cypher query language to retrieve data from a graph database.' Which Bloom's Taxonomy level does this represent?
What is the purpose of using action verbs in learning outcomes?
What threshold score indicates an acceptable course description quality for proceeding with learning graph generation?
Why is defining the target audience important in a course description for intelligent textbook creation?
Which cognitive level in Bloom's Taxonomy involves breaking down information into component parts to understand organizational structure?
What is the primary purpose of a learning graph in intelligent textbook creation?
What distinguishes concept nodes from general graph vertices in a learning graph?
In a learning graph, what does a directed edge from concept A to concept B indicate?
Why must a valid learning graph be a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG)?
A learning graph contains concepts X, Y, and Z with dependencies X → Y → Z. What type of prerequisite relationship exists between X and Z?
If your learning graph generation consumes 40,000 tokens, approximately how long must you wait before those tokens become available again in your Claude Pro account?
What is the recommended approach for managing Claude Pro token budgets when generating a complete intelligent textbook?
Given a learning graph fragment where 'Programming Basics' has no incoming edges and enables both 'Variables' and 'Functions,' which pattern does this illustrate?
For a 13-chapter textbook with balanced concept distribution, approximately how many concepts should each chapter contain?
Which statement best describes the relationship between concept depth and chapter placement in a well-structured textbook?
What is the recommended target number of concepts for a standard semester-length course learning graph?
Which of the following concept labels correctly follows Title Case convention?
What is the maximum character length permitted for a concept label, including spaces?
A proposed concept is titled 'Complete Overview of All Machine Learning Algorithms and Their Applications.' What is the primary problem with this concept?
In the CSV format for learning graphs, how are multiple dependencies represented in the Dependencies field?
If a learning graph CSV contains the row '5,Directed Acyclic Graph,3|4,CORE', what does this indicate?

You are creating a learning graph and want to add a new concept about 'Python list comprehensions.' You determine it requires understanding of both 'Python lists' (concept 12) and 'For loops' (concept 15). How should you represent this in the CSV?
What percentage of concepts in a well-balanced learning graph should typically be foundational concepts with zero dependencies?
In a 200-concept learning graph, approximately how many concepts should be advanced/integrative concepts with 4 or more dependencies?
What is the primary purpose of the TaxonomyID field in the learning graph CSV?
What is the time complexity of the DFS-based cycle detection algorithm used to validate learning graphs?
During DFS-based cycle detection, what does encountering a gray node indicate?
What does an orphaned node in a learning graph represent?
In a healthy learning graph, what percentage of concepts should typically be orphaned nodes?
You run analyze-graph.py and discover your learning graph contains a cycle: A → B → C → D → A. What is the recommended approach to resolve this?
What is the optimal range for average dependencies per concept in a learning graph?
A learning graph has 200 concepts and 620 total dependency edges. What is the average dependencies per concept, and how should this be interpreted?
Your learning graph quality report shows a score of 68. What action should you take?
In taxonomy distribution analysis, what threshold indicates over-representation of a single category?
Which Python script converts learning graph CSV format to vis-network JSON format for visualization?
What is the recommended length for TaxonomyID abbreviations in learning graph CSV files?
In the vis-network JSON format, which section defines visual styling like background color and node shape for each taxonomy category?
What are the four primary sections of the vis-network JSON format for learning graphs?
In the nodes section of vis-network JSON, what three required properties must each node object contain?
You are converting a learning graph CSV row with ConceptID=10 and Dependencies='3|7|9'. How many edge objects will be created in the vis-network JSON?
Which Dublin Core metadata field should use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)?
In semantic versioning for learning graphs, what does incrementing the MINOR version number indicate?
According to WCAG accessibility guidelines, what is the minimum contrast ratio required for normal text?
What is the recommended approach when a single taxonomy category contains 35% of all concepts in your learning graph?
Which script should you run to analyze whether your learning graph has balanced representation across taxonomy categories?
What is MkDocs primarily designed for?
Which file serves as the central configuration document for a MkDocs site?
What does the Material for MkDocs theme add beyond basic MkDocs functionality?
What markdown syntax is used to create an admonition in MkDocs?
In Git version control, what is a commit?
Which Git command uploads local commits to a remote repository like GitHub?
A team is building documentation for a software project and needs to ensure that markdown lists render correctly. What formatting requirement must they follow?
An educational project needs documentation that works offline, has no security vulnerabilities from dynamic components, and can be hosted anywhere. Which approach best meets these requirements?
Why does the Material theme's navigation structure benefit from explicit configuration in mkdocs.yml rather than automatic generation from file structure?
What does the `mkdocs gh-deploy` command accomplish?
What is the primary skill definition file that serves as the entry point for Claude?
Which category of supporting assets provides computational capabilities for tasks that exceed Claude's direct tool access?
What is the purpose of reference documentation files in Claude Skills?
Which testing strategy verifies that a skill performs correctly with missing files or malformed data?
In Claude Skills security model, what is the principle behind the allowed-tools field?
Where are globally installed skills stored to make them available across all projects?
A developer needs to create a skill that will be used across multiple intelligent textbook projects with identical functionality. Should they use global or project-specific installation?
What is the purpose of the `git status` command?
A skill requires the Python packages pandas, networkx, and matplotlib. How should these dependencies be documented and installed?
Why is distributing skills via Git repositories more flexible than packaged archives?
What are the essential components that every chapter in an intelligent textbook should include?
What is the primary purpose of chapter index files in the content generation workflow?
How does reading level affect content generation for intelligent textbooks?
What is the average sentence length for college-level educational content?
According to cognitive load theory, why are worked examples particularly effective for novice learners?
How many worked examples should typically be included per major concept in a chapter?

A textbook author is creating practice exercises for a chapter on content workflows. They want to ensure exercises address different cognitive levels. Which exercise type represents Bloom's "Analyze" level?
Which ISO 11179 principle is violated by the definition: "Learning Graph: A graph that we use for learning"?
Why must glossary definitions be "free of business rules" according to ISO 11179 standards?
What is the primary function of the concept list within a chapter index file?
What is the primary pedagogical function of FAQs in intelligent textbooks?
Which category of common student questions addresses uncertainty about required background knowledge?
At what stage in the textbook development workflow should the FAQ generator skill be executed?
What is the key pedagogical weakness of quiz questions that focus exclusively on the Remember level of Bloom's Taxonomy?
In a well-designed multiple-choice question, what is the primary diagnostic value of distractors?

Your intelligent textbook has a learning graph with 200 concepts. You need to create quizzes that properly assess student understanding across chapters. How should quiz questions be aligned with the learning graph?
What is the recommended Bloom's Taxonomy distribution for formative quizzes embedded in intelligent textbooks?
You notice that 60% of students consistently select the same incorrect answer on a quiz question. What does this pattern most likely indicate, and what action should you take?
What is the primary purpose of the add-taxonomy.py script in the intelligent textbook workflow?
When using the taxonomy-distribution.py script, what does it indicate if a single taxonomy category contains 45% of all concepts in the learning graph?
What distinguishes a MicroSim from a traditional comprehensive educational simulation?
What is the primary advantage of using p5.js for educational MicroSim development?
According to the table comparing content types, what learning analytics potential do MicroSims provide compared to static text or images?
What are the three mandatory files in every MicroSim directory?
Why must the main.html file be entirely self-contained except for the p5.js library?
You are embedding a MicroSim that has an 800x600 canvas and a 200-pixel control panel. The simulation is in the same directory as your index.md file. Which iframe code is correct?
What is the primary pedagogical benefit of implementing seeded randomness in educational MicroSims?
You are creating a physics simulation where students should be able to adjust gravity continuously and observe immediate effects on falling objects. Which interactive control is most appropriate?

When designing a MicroSim, you notice that adding multiple visualization modes, parameter controls, and algorithm options has made the interface complex and confusing. According to educational simulation design principles, what should you do?
What information should be included in the educational section of a MicroSim's metadata.json file?
